channel.title: EPA in Kentucky
channel.description: Updated EPA in Kentucky content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Public Notice: KY17UIC003 - KenAmerican Resources, Inc.; Bremen, Kentucky
item.description:
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 4 intends to issue an Underground Injection Control (UIC) Class 5 permit under the authority of Title 40 the Code of Federal Regulations at Parts 124, 144, 146, and 147 to KenAmerican Resources, Inc. Any person wishing to comment on any aspect of the proposed permit should do so within 30 days of the date of the Public Notice (January 17, 2017).

  • Public notice KY17UIC003 (PDF)(29 pp, 162 K)
item.dc:creator: smaddox

item.title: Public Notice: KY17UIC002 - Ogenoco, LLC, Livonia, Michigan
item.description:
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 4 intends to issue an Underground Injection Control (UIC) Class II-D permit under the authority of Title 40 the Code of Federal Regulations at Parts 124, 144, 146, and 147 to Ogenoco, LLC. Any person wishing to comment on any aspects of the proposed permit issuance should do so within 30 days of the date of the Public Notice.

  • KY17UIC002 - Ogenoco, LLC, Livonia, Michigan (PDF)(24 pp, 299 K)
item.dc:creator: smaddox

item.title: Public Notice: KY16UIC001 - KWR Ventures, LLC, Harrisburg, Illinois
item.description:
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 4 intends to issue an Underground Injection Control (UIC) Class II-D permit under the authority of Title 40 the Code of Federal Regulations at Parts 124, 144, 146, and 147 to KWR Ventures, LLC. Any person wishing to comment on any aspect of the proposed Consent Agreement and Final Order should do so within 30 days of the date of the Public Notice.

  • Public Notice: KY16UIC001 - KWR Ventures, LLC (PDF)(24 pp, 173 K)
item.dc:creator: smaddox

item.title: Environmental Information for Kentucky
item.description:
• Air
  • Water
  • Land and Waste Cleanups
  • Pesticides and Other Toxic Chemicals
  • Real-time map of today's air quality forecast in Kentucky on AirNow.gov
  • MyAir. MyAir shows many different kinds of air data for Kentucky.
  • MyClimate. MyClimate shows greenhouse gas emissions by sector, and other kinds of climate data, for Kentucky.
  • Clean Air Act permitting in Kentucky
  • Fact sheet on the Clean Power Plan for Kentucky (2 pp, 238 K, About PDF)
  • Real-time radiation data from monitors located in Kentucky:
    • Lexington
    • Louisville
    • Paducah
  • State Implementation Plans (SIPs) for air quality approved by EPA for Kentucky
  • Air compliance dashboard: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboard provides an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
  • MyWater. MyWater shows many different kinds of water data for Kentucky.
  • Drinking water information
  • Water pollution permits (NPDES permits)
  • Water quality standards
  • Region 4 actions to address climate change impacts on water
  • Managing ocean dumping off of Region 4's coasts
  • Climate-Ready Estuaries projects in Region 4
  • Underground injection control program in Region 4
  • Compliance dashboards: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboards provide an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
    • Drinking water dashboard
    • U.S. waters dashboard
  • List of all cleanups
  • Map of all cleanups
  • List of Superfund sites
  • List of Base Realignment and Closure (BRAC) sites
  • Brownfields and land revitalization in Region 4
  • Hazardous waste compliance dashboard: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboard provides an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
  • Agency in Kentucky that regulates pesticides Exit
  • Most recent fact sheet on the management of certain toxic chemicals in Kentucky from EPA's Toxic Release Inventory
    • Go to approved SIPs in Region 4
  • Pesticides compliance dashboard: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboard provides an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
item.dc:creator: smaddox

item.title: List of Superfund Sites in Kentucky
item.description:
Related Information

  • View a community guide to EPA's Superfund program (PDF)(2 pp, 454KB)
  • Learn more about...
    • The Superfund cleanup process
    • Deleting sites from the National Priorities List
  • Frequent questions about Superfund

Below is a list that shows:

  • proposed, final and deleted sites on the National Priorities ListNational Priorities ListEPA's list of the most serious uncontrolled or abandoned hazardous waste sites identified for possible long-term remedial action under Superfund. The list is based primarily on the score a site receives from the Hazard Ranking System. (NPL)
  • non-NPL sites subject to Superfund alternative approach (SAA) agreements.
All Sites

item.dc:creator: rwashing

item.title: Contact Us about EPA in Kentucky
item.description:
Report a Violation

Report possible violations of environmental laws and regulations.

Please use the form below to send us comments or questions. Be sure to include your e-mail address if you’d like a response.

Mailing Address:

United States Environmental Protection Agency
Region 4
Sam Nunn Atlanta Federal Center
61 Forsyth Street, SW 
Atlanta, GA 30303-8960

Main: (404) 562-9900
Toll Free: 1-800-241-1754
Fax: (404) 562-8174
